IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Riverview School, an independent coeducational residential school, provides a caring community for adolescents and young adults with complex language, learning and cognitive disabilities. The School is committed to developing student competence and confidence in academic, social and independent living skills.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Riverview School, an independent coeducational residential school, provides a caring community for adolescents and young adults with complex language, learning and cognitive disabilities. The School is committed to developing student competence and confidence in academic, social and independent living skills.
IRS990.Description: Residential/Day treatment and education of learning disabled adolescents and adults (195 individuals served in fiscal year 2010).

Activity2.Description: Residential and work experience for learning disabled adults (4 individuals served in fiscal year 2010).

Activity3.Description: Residential/Day summer program for learning disabled adolescents and adults (111 individuals served in fiscal year 2010).

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Organization holds custodial funds on behalf of their clients. These funds are held for their clients individual personal needs.

Part X, Line 2 - Tax Status The Organization is qualified under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (the "Code") and is exempt from federal and state income taxes. The Organization is not a private foundation within the meaning of Section 509(a) of the Code because it is an organization as described in Sections 509(a)(1) and 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) of the Code as an educational organization. As of July 1, 2009, the Organization adopted the provisions of accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America related to accounting for uncertainty in income taxes. The provisions prescribe a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. Application of these provisions has not resulted in the recognition of any financial assets or liabilities. The Organization's information returns for the years ended June 30, 2007 through 2010 are subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service and a state regulatory agency, although no such examinations have been initiated as of the date of the Report of the Independent Auditors.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Through advertisements in trade publications, school associations, and national accreditation booklets and materials.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: RIVERVIEW SCHOOL, INC. IS A PRIVATE RESIDENTIAL/DAY SCHOOL APPROVED BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION AND RECEIVES FUNDING FROM VARIOUS STATE AGENCIES AND CITIES AND TOWNS BOTH WITHIN AND OUTSIDE MASSACHUSETTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Financial aid is available to families with a demonstrtated financial need.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: During the year ended June 30, 2010, the Organization received a donation of 4,000 shares of KFT stock, valued at $27.045 per share at the date of donation for a total fair market value of $108,180. This amount was not reported as revenue in column (c) as it was a payment on a prior year pledge made by the donor. In accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, the related revenue was recorded in the year the pledge was made.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Trustees Edward Muller and Patricia Bauer are married.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization's Head of School, Business Manager and Finance Committee review a draft of the Form 990, which is prepared by the Organization's independent accountants. Any resultant comments and changes are incorporated into the form by the independent accountants. A final version of the Form 990 is then provided to each member of the Board of Trustees prior to its filing with the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All officers and trustees of the Organization are required to file a statement on an annual basis disclosing any potential interests that could give rise to conflicts. These statements are completed at the beginning of each fiscal year and are evaluated by the officers of the Organization. Individuals with potential conflicts of interest are prohibited from participating in any deliberations or decisions that may be effected by a potential conflict of interest.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation of the Head of School is reviewed on an annual basis in connection with the Organization's budgeting process. The Board of Trustees, with the support of an independent compensation consultant, reviews and approves the compensation of the Head of School using data for comparable organizations. Such deliberations and decisions are recorded in the meeting minutes.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization's audited financial statements are available to the public via the websites of certain state regulatory agencies as well as upon request.
Consistent with prior years, the Finance Committee of the Organization is responsible for overseeing the annual audit.
